intro: Verbascum myconium, commonly known as the mossy mullein, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
